sentences.english: He sports an ivory-handled cane these days.
sentences.chinese: 这些天，他夸耀着他的镶有象牙的手杖。

sentences.english: However you praise the film, I just feel it so-so.
sentences.chinese: 不管你怎么夸耀那部影片，可我觉得它不过如此。

sentences.english: There are bragging rights in the bed of that truck — and there's venison.
sentences.chinese: 车上的鹿让她们有了夸耀的权利。

sentences.english: The latter are "not a sustainable source of happiness, " Rayo said.
sentences.chinese: 夸耀是一种“难以为继的幸福来源”，Rayo说道。

sentences.english: Need Help or Want to Brag?
sentences.chinese: 需要帮助，还是想要夸耀？

sentences.english: Some parents always boast of their childrens acquirement.
sentences.chinese: 有些父母总爱夸耀自己孩子的才能。

sentences.english: He often boasts of his learning.
sentences.chinese: 他常常夸耀自己的学问。

sentences.english: He always crowed about his examination results.
sentences.chinese: 他总是夸耀自己的考试成绩。

sentences.english: The greatest friend the packaging industry has is the sporting instinct of the buying public.
sentences.chinese: 包装业最伟大的朋友就是顾客好夸耀的天性。

sentences.english: Indeed this ery loe which is my boast.
sentences.chinese: 说真的，就是这为我所夸耀的爱吧。

sentences.english: Teach sin the carriage of a holy saint;
sentences.chinese: 哪一个笨贼夸耀他自己的罪状？

sentences.english: Want to brag to your friends about how fast you were cruising down the double black diamond?
sentences.chinese: 想跟朋友夸耀自己在双黑道上滑的特别快？

sentences.english: China cannot win affection by flaunting economic power.
sentences.chinese: 中国不会因为夸耀自己的经济力量而被喜爱。

sentences.english: He bragged about how brave he was.
His corse may boast its urn and narrow cave.
sentences.chinese: 让他的尸首去夸耀它的陋穴和骨灰瓮。

definition: to regard it as an honor (idiom)
to praise/to speak highly of/to commend
to show off/to make a display of
to praise/to approve of/to show approval
